      • validateSize

        protected String validateSize(String size)
        Validates the specified size is properly formatted. A size is valid if it can be parsed by width(BaseTableLayout, String) and height(BaseTableLayout, String). All sizes that are stored as strings pass through this method, providing a hook to validate sizes at parse time rather than layout time. The default implementation just returns the specified string. If the specified String is invalid, an exception should be thrown.

      • newWidget

        public C newWidget(L layout,
          String className)
        Creates a new widget from the specified class name. This can be overriden to create widgets using shortcut names (eg, "button"). The default implementation creates an instance of the class and calls wrap(BaseTableLayout, Object).
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the class could be found or otherwise failed to be instantiated.
        See Also:
        addClassPrefix(String)

      • newInstance

        protected C newInstance(L layout,
            String className)
                 throws Exception
        Returns an instance of the specified class. This can be overidden to control what constructor and what classloader to use. The default implementation uses Class.forName(className).newInstance().
        Throws:
        Exception - if the class cannot be found or instantiated.

      • wrap

        public C wrap(L layout,
     Object object)
        Wraps the specified object in a widget. The default implementation handles the object being a TableLayout or widget. If the object is null, a placeholder widget to use for empty cells must be returned. If the object is a string, a label widget must be returned. Otherwise, the object can be any other class that was added to the table (eg, a Swing LayoutManager would be wrapped in a JPanel).
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the object could not be wrapped.

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(L layout,
               C object,
               String name,
               List<String> values)
        Sets a property on the widget. This is called for widget properties specified in the table description. The default implementation attempts to find a method, bean setter method, or field that will accept the specified values.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the property could not be set.

      • setTableProperty

        public void setTableProperty(L layout,
                    String name,
                    List<String> values)
        Sets a property on the table. This is called for table properties specified in the table description.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the property could not be set.

      • setCellProperty

        public void setCellProperty(Cell c,
                   String name,
                   List<String> values)
        Sets a property on the cell. This is called for cell properties specified in the table description.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the property could not be set.

      • width

        public int width(L layout,
        String value)
        Interprets the specified value as a width. This can be used to scale all sizes applied to a cell, implement size units (eg, 23px or 23em), etc. The default implementation converts to an int and calls width(float). Zero is used for null and empty string. If the suffix is "%", the value is converted to an int, divided by 100, and multiplied by BaseTableLayout.getLayoutWidth(). If the suffix is "px", the value is converted to int without the suffix and returned unscaled.
        Parameters:
        value - May be null.

      • width

        public int width(float value)
        Interprets the specified value as a size. This can be used to scale all sizes applied to a cell. The default implementation just casts to int.

      • height

        public int height(L layout,
         String value)
        Interprets the specified value as a height. This can be used to scale all sizes applied to a cell, implement size units (eg, 23px or 23em), etc. The default implementation converts to an int and calls height(float). Zero is used for null and empty string. If the suffix is "%", the value is converted to an int, divided by 100, and multiplied by BaseTableLayout.getLayoutHeight(). If the suffix is "px", the value is converted to int without the suffix and returned unscaled.
        Parameters:
        value - May be null.

      • height

        public int height(float value)
        Interprets the specified value as a size. This can be used to scale all sizes applied to a cell. The default implementation just casts to int.

      • convertType

        protected Object convertType(L layout,
                 Object parentObject,
                 Class memberType,
                 String memberName,
                 String value)
        Attempts to convert a string value to a type to match a field or method on the specified parentObject. The default implementation tries all primitive type wrappers and looks for a static field with the name on both the specified type and the parentObject's type.
        Returns:
        the converted type, or null if it could not be converted.
